summaries.body: A suspect in a string of burglaries in Florida was killed by an alligator while hiding from police in a lake, according to an autopsy.
A petition calling for Donald J. Trump to be barred from Britain gained more than 100,000 signatures — a threshold that requires Parliament to consider the matter for debate.

display_asset.caption: An Afghan Air Force student pilot from the 81st Fighter Squadron, sets up the communications panel before his first time flying an A-29 Super Tucano March 5, 2015, at Moody Air Force Base, Ga.
display_asset.credit: Airman 1st Class Ceaira Tinsley/U.S. Air Force

summaries.body: Two men from Afghanistan who were in the United States for training at Moody Air Force Base in Georgia are missing, the base said.
The North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is sending the girl band he formed to China to improve strained relations between the two countries.

display_asset.caption: Julia Moskin makes a classic ragù with sausage and tomato.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By JASON LEE and DEVON KNIGHT

sectionFrontImages.credit: Rikki Snyder for The New York Times

display_asset.title: Recipe Lab: Ragù

summaries.body: On the fence about what to make for dinner tonight? Learn how to make a classic ragù with sausage and tomato.
A new study has found that text messages that end in periods are perceived by recipients to be less sincere.

display_asset.caption: People filming a flag-raising ceremony during heavy smog at Tiananmen Square in Beijing on Wednesday.

summaries.body: As Beijing chokes on smog for the second day in a row, cities that were even more polluted than the Chinese capital had enacted milder emergency plans, or none at all.
Some Twitter users have found their feeds no longer in reverse chronological order but instead sorted by an algorithm that a Twitter spokesman called "an experiment."
"The Hunger Games" may not necessarily be over, according to the vice chairman of Lionsgate, who told a conference that he could envision a series of prequels.

display_asset.caption: Senator Bernie Sanders, and Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show on Tuesday.

summaries.body: On “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon," Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont left no question that he thinks Donald J. Trump is a rabble-rouser.
The heavyweight champion Tyson Fury is the subject of a hate-crime inquiry in England for comments about gays, and the BBC said he had been stripped of his I.B.F. belt.
Several news reports indicate new suspects in the search for the creator of the digital currency Bitcoin, the origin of which has long been a mystery.
Taxi drivers are planning a protest in Toronto on Wednesday to express anger over Uber. Cabs will gather in four secret outlying spots and converge on City Hall.
Diane Rehm, a mainstay on NPR since 1979 whose current-affairs show is distributed to nearly 200 stations, said she planned to retire after the 2016 election.
The family of the former hockey player Steve Montador, who died Feb. 15, has filed a lawsuit against the N.H.L. that claims the league did not protect him from head injuries.

display_asset.caption: A Chipotle restaurant near Boston College was temporarily closed after 80 students reported getting sick after eating there.

summaries.body: Eighty Boston College students became ill after eating at a local Chipotle, the school says.

display_asset.caption: Fox Business News hosted a Republican presidential debate in Milwaukee on Nov. 10.
display_asset.credit: Michael Appleton for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Fox Business Network will host another Republican presidential debate in North Charleston, S.C., on Jan. 14.

posts.footer: Wayne Coyne of the Flaming Lips on working with Miley Cyrus. The New York Times

display_asset.caption: Wayne Coyne and Miley Cyrus performing at the MTV Video Music Awards in August.

summaries.body: I think because I’m so old and because she’s so young, we reach around and meet in back.

display_asset.caption: Inside the Museum of Feelings, an elaborate, walk-through advertisement for Glade products in Battery Park City in Lower Manhattan.
display_asset.credit: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

summaries.body: People have been lining up to get into the Museum of Feelings, a pop-up installation in Manhattan that is actually an elaborate, walk-through advertisement for fragrance products.

display_asset.caption: Center from left: Anthony Ramos, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Daveed Diggs and Okieriete Onaodowan in the musical "Hamilton" at the Richard Rodgers Theater.

summaries.body: “Hamilton,” the smash Broadway musical about America’s first Treasury secretary, will have an open-ended production in Chicago starting next fall.

display_asset.caption: A customer checked out weapons at Pony Express Firearms in Parker, Colo., on Monday. Many Americans have been stocking up.

summaries.body: Two television entrepreneurs in California think they have just what America needs: a 24-hour shopping channel for guns called GunTV. It is expected to debut on Jan. 20.

display_asset.caption: A Chinese woman wears a mask to protect against pollution as two women take a photograph in heavy smog on Dec. 8, 2015 in Beijing.

summaries.body: As Beijing enacted emergency steps to cope with its first “red alert” over pollution, images on social media documented how the smog is affecting the city.

posts.footer: Mary Forsberg Weiland wrote an open letter about the death of Scott Weiland, her ex-husband and the former Stone Temple Pilots singer, via Rolling Stone

summaries.body: But the truth is, like so many other kids, they lost their father years ago. What they truly lost on December 3rd was hope.
A choir in Boston for transgender singers is teaching members how to adjust their voices to match their gender identities without hurting their vocal cords.

display_asset.caption: This adaptation of Sophocles’s “Antigone” being performed in New York City fuses flamenco dancing and krump, a style of hip-hop dance.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By ERICA BERENSTEIN and BEN LAFFIN
display_asset.title: Fusing Flamenco and Krump

summaries.body: An adaptation of Sophocles’s “Antigone” fuses flamenco dancing and krump, a style of hip-hop dance.
An off-duty police officer responding to an automobile ad on Craigslist fatally shot one of two men who tried to rob him when he showed up to buy the car in Queens.
Mass killers are often paid more attention than their victims. But another group is seldom discussed at all: Those like Cheyeanne Fitzgerald, 16, who survive mass shootings.
Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., speaking in Kiev, said Russian cooperation in Syria would not change U.S. support for Ukraine in its conflict with pro-Russian separatists.
More than 80 book critics from outside Britain were asked to contribute to a new ranking of the best British novels.

display_asset.caption: From left, Igor Zubov, a Russian deputy minister of internal affairs, Jean-Maurice Ripert, the French ambassador to Russia, who is holding Dobrynya, and Mr. Ripert's wife, Yael, at a presentation ceremony at the French Embassy in Moscow.

summaries.body: Russia presented France with a puppy to replace a police dog killed after the attacks in Paris last month. The French ambassador called it “a gesture that comes from the heart.”
